document.title: Ohio’s Learning Standards – Extended English Language Proficiency

69DC1B1C79624179B8BB14D643FCAE83.description:
respond to simple questions (e.g., yes or
no, wh- questions).

5E538CD62DE24BA5806D4895151E79FA.description:
recognize and use a small number of
frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

25BE83AD32B24CE8AF4E01B1B16555E0.description:
produce simple sentences on a familiar
topic.

097750776C1C4EFC9DFB1EA7EDD9CE3D.description:
recognize and use a small number of
frequently occurring nouns, verbs,
prepositions and conjunctions.

8FA4866132AB49DD9274BF391876ECE0.description:
produce simple and compound
sentences on familiar topics.

F2B107D6E389476AA15C9968C2D885F2.description:
recognize and use an increasing number
of nouns, verbs, prepositions and
conjunctions.

61CDD2DD86C44A77A61F16BF8C62D665.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
make accurate use of standard
English to communicate in grade appropriate speech and writing

CB1863DA0EC84568AAA79FF23B95BE8A.description:
with emerging control of some frequently
occurring linking words.

E57B3CC14BCD454F92BA01EBB1C66785.description:
communicate a familiar event or simple
information about a familiar topic.

286296027B1C45B89D6545519656591D.description:
communicate simple information about a
familiar topic with developing control of
some frequently occurring linking words.

DDBB9FF4ECED4F96BD0216572C643205.description: retell a simple sequence of events.

DD2F9AA8138648C5B629D78C127A4B04.description:
communicate simple information about a
familiar topic with increasing control of
some temporal words (e.g., next, after)
and some frequently occurring linking
words.

0A1B6165B7AC40528C18DB8EE48F1F2E.description:
retell two or three events in sequence of
events.

1861384BE11D44A3B6276B098AD7576E.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
create clear and coherent grade appropriate speech and text.

BB580100D1E641ADAACCB3FF0C53C4F6.description:
in simple oral presentations and readalouds about familiar topics, experiences
or events.

E4DDF756C85B455CA9D2D66D531F61A6.description:
recognize the meaning of a few
frequently occurring words.

0D5656EC543D48CE880B6FAE934A5F5A.description:
in simple oral presentations, read-alouds,
and simple texts about familiar topics,
experiences or events.

DCEA59A0813E4C25B884F8AD73D89469.description:
answer simple questions to help
determine the meaning of some
frequently occurring words and phrases.

25E1C5E1187E495BBFFF22EC9D1F812D.description:
answer and sometimes ask simple
questions to help determine the meaning
of some less-frequently occurring words
and phrases in simple oral presentations,
read-alouds, and simple texts about
familiar topics, experiences or events.

1774C7ED0549448094A91638375D02E6.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
determine the meaning of words
and phrases in oral presentations
and literary and informational text.

EE3EF416F4C44CF0A50A5961E0B5ED5C.description:
indicate awareness of the appropriate
language for the playground and for the
classroom.

96502DDD25E149BDB7A930212A85E725.description:
indicate the appropriate audience or task
from a field of options when presented
with familiar phrases and simple
sentences.

B57BB1102BE54E3BB4CBE993B2CEF325.description:
show a developing awareness of the
difference between appropriate language
for the playground and language for the
classroom.

AD5091D87E25455F9BB54FAB9AF81813.description:
show awareness of the difference
between appropriate language for the
playground and language for the
classroom.

3CE74E533E15499392D80452A6C174B7.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities
adapt language choices to
purpose, task, and audience
when speaking and writing.

6F00190E6C4D42378C171A837B12164C.description:
identify the main idea of a simple
presentation of a familiar topic.

CC5B00C5CFEC4B54965EE9EDDA85A270.description:
identify a key detail that supports the
main idea of a simple presentation on a
familiar topic.

368A07BCC225406A8E72D0377FD4C284.description:
identify key details that support the main
idea of a simple presentation on a
familiar topic.

C48B949D4DE147AAB6929E56BFE4D59C.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
analyze and critique the arguments
of others orally and in writing.

A7300EECB26E4FD09346EB06CB6FAAF3.description:
label information from provided sources
showing limited control.

59328CF19FF24CB784A928F2F4C1ED37.description:
retell key information from provided
sources showing emerging control.

2402AAE151B34DA48DC3D9D9163A80BF.description:
answer a question from provided sources
showing increasing control.

3CEE8470204D4FDB8BBAA6C94A60C5BE.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
conduct research and evaluate and
communicate findings to answer
questions or solve problems.

4A5F58791DC84EA9BC32A4E2F5FB366F.description:
indicate a feeling or opinion about
familiar topics or experiences.

5FF9CA07D55F44C7AF84906788DBD4DD.description:
identify a feeling or opinion about
familiar topics, experiences or events.

1E9EA474EA4846059345C01DEFC5F251.description:
express an opinion or preference about
familiar topics, stories, experiences or
events.

F87B76A8004045CAA13956908A77C829.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
construct grade-appropriate oral
and written claims and support
them with reasoning and evidence.

C73381629D3A4C79A1D9548E422D523D.description:
communicate simple information or
feelings about familiar topics or
experiences.

42D262E944AC4C5E88F2A81DB9FE6C34.description:
communicate simple messages about
familiar topics, experiences or events.

6EBDF89BAD0E4CEA84AF9DEF02C18E2A.description:
tell or dictate simple information about
familiar topics, stories, experiences or
events.

42A6AF6A97A844A18BA7C89BD66F8809.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
speak and write about grade appropriate complex literary and
informational texts and topics.

4B55F1B1152C4863BA41F23B68506BC3.description:
Limited participation: Pointing to pictures,
eye contact – looking at the speaker,
knocking, eye gazing, blinking, pointing
nose, sounds.

B64EC9FD6F834F68A278E25622C58656.description:
respond to simple yes/no questions
about familiar topics.

5A02FF8E599840E5AB36D39FE571826A.description:
listen with limited participation in short
conversations.

ED6ABB4157174D35AD838A0FA7B55876.description:
follow simple rules for discussion about
familiar topics.

4C1AC3472D7B480588F769BD0B65F7CE.description:
respond to simple yes and no questions
and wh- questions.

48551F4136CA45978FF983C136D7199D.description:
listen with some participation in short
conversations.

40BC7F1E66434098BD257874F489B7A9.description:
follow some rules for discussion about
familiar topics.

F42C99E261B54B7D99FBF275B79282AD.description:
respond to simple yes and no questions
and wh- questions

D352C83BC25E449090729479398C7037.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
participate in grade-appropriate oral
and written exchanges of
information, ideas, and analyses,
responding to peer, audience, or
reader comments and questions.

B2C8E52E06F9445D990E014C7082D2EA.description:
Limited set of strategies may include
matching identical pictures, making a
choice between two pictures and
choosing the real item (realia).

99F4F35095324C91B622AF80F4408444.description:
identify a few key words from readalouds, oral presentations and simple
written texts.

4C090158059C4719B3EB5B11420BA5B7.description:
With prompting and support, use a very
limited set of strategies to:

AF062ED81E884B9498DC85F51E0C8728.description:
identify key words and main topics from
read-alouds, oral presentations, and
simple written texts.

7F679CA58BFE4B33A32791D6F8B945F7.description:
With prompting and support, use an
emerging set of strategies to:

33CA7E6F42BD4A24B6F8223CEBD9179F.description:
retell basic information from read-alouds,
oral presentations and simple written
texts.

4983A34BAEEE4E788C71D3266D149E5B.description:
With prompting and support, use an
increasing range of strategies to:

D7449FD8FAB74A3ABA0548A741AC395F.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
construct meaning from oral
presentations and literary and
informational text through grade appropriate listening, reading, and
viewing.
